about_me.text: Hi! I am a junior front-end developer with over a year of experience building websites. I am currently looking for a new oportunity, my inbox is aways open. Whether you have any question or just want to talk, i will try my best to get back to you!

projects.title: Dashboard Finances Buffer
projects.subtitle: This project is a bank-like financial statement manager, developed collaboratively by a team of five developers. It simulates core banking functionalities with a focus on performance, usability, and maintainability.
keys: Front-End Stack: Built using React, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and Base UI, combining utility-first styling with a flexible component library.
Testing & Quality Assurance: Implemented comprehensive front-end testing using Vitest for unit tests and Cypress for end-to-end testing.
Component Documentation: All UI components were documented using Storybook, ensuring consistency and ease of collaboration across the team.

projects.title: My Ride
projects.subtitle: This project is a sample application designed for a ride request platform, developed using modern front-end technologies to ensure both performance and visual consistency.
keys: Tech Stack: Built with React.js, TypeScript, Material UI, and Styled Components to deliver a robust and scalable user interface.
Design Consistency: The combination of Material UI and Styled Components was strategically chosen to meet specific design requirements while optimizing development time.
Efficient Development: Leveraging pre-built style libraries allowed the team to stay within the project’s time constraints without compromising on quality or user experience.

projects.title: Plant Peace
projects.subtitle: This is my second front-end project developed during my internship at Compass UOL. It’s an e-commerce website focused on selling plants, built collaboratively by a team of four developers.
keys: Modern Tech Stack: Built using React.js and CSS Modules, ensuring reusable components and custom styling across the application.
Real-Time Form Validation: The plant registration page includes a form with real-time input validation, manually implemented by me using JavaScript.
Modular & Custom Design:** CSS Modules were used to craft exclusive, component-scoped styles, enhancing both maintainability and visual consistency.

projects.title: Compass Form
projects.subtitle: This front-end project marks my first major development endeavor of 2023, created during my internship at Compass UOL. It showcases a multi-step form interface, thoughtfully designed to guide users through a seamless input experience.
keys: Modular Architecture: Built with clean, maintainable HTML and CSS modules.
Dynamic Interactivity: JavaScript powers the form logic, enabling smooth navigation between pages.
Persistent Data Storage: User responses are securely stored using the browser’s Local Storage, ensuring data remains intact across sessions.
